text:
typically about 5% to 6% of the gross value for solid and liquid fuels and about 10% for natural
gas.
There are a few fuels which contain no, or very little, hydrogen (for example blastfurnace gas,
high-temperature cokes and some petroleum cokes). In these cases, there will be negligible
differences between net and gross calorific values.
